rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The website's content does not provide sufficient information to determine the use of pure black (#000000) for text and backgrounds. Without access to the website's CSS or visual elements, it's not possible to confirm compliance with the guideline to avoid pure black for text and backgrounds.

rule.title: Enable lazy loading for images and videos
rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The website's HTML content does not include any attributes like 'loading="lazy"' for images or videos, indicating that lazy loading is not implemented. Implementing lazy loading would improve page load times and performance by loading images and videos only when they enter the viewport, except for above-the-fold content which should load immediately.

rule.title: Display breadcrumb navigation
rule.description: Breadcrumbs should be visible near the top of the product page to help users understand site hierarchy, navigate back to categories, and improve usability and SEO. Each breadcrumb should be clickable except the current product.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The Heyday Canning Co. homepage does not display breadcrumb navigation. Breadcrumbs are essential for helping users understand site hierarchy and navigate back to categories. Their absence on the homepage indicates a lack of this navigational aid.

rule.title: Sticky Add to Cart button
rule.description: A sticky or floating Add to Cart button should remain visible when the main CTA scrolls out of view to reduce friction and keep users focused on the primary conversion goal.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The homepage does not feature a sticky or floating 'Add to Cart' button that remains visible when the main call-to-action (CTA) scrolls out of view. The primary CTA on the homepage is the 'Shop Now' button, which directs users to the product pages. However, once users navigate to the product pages, the 'Add to Cart' button is not sticky or floating; it remains static within the page content. This design choice may lead to a less seamless shopping experience, as users need to

rule.title: Show product ratings near title
rule.description: Product ratings should appear close to the product title and include both the average rating and total number of reviews. Clicking the rating should scroll users to the reviews section.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The Heyday Canning Co. website does not display product ratings near the product titles. For example, the homepage features products like 'Tomato Ricotta Lasagna Soup' and 'Creamy Coconut Corn Chowder', but there are no visible ratings or review counts associated with these items. Additionally, clicking on individual product pages does not reveal any customer reviews or ratings. This absence of ratings near product titles means the website does not meet the specified rule.

rule.title: Use descriptive and clear product titles
rule.description: Product titles should clearly describe the product using relevant attributes such as brand, size, color, and key characteristics. Titles should be concise, specific, and optimized for SEO (under ~65 characters).

expectedResult.reason: Rule passed because: The product titles on the Heyday Canning Co. website are descriptive and clear, effectively conveying the product's key attributes. For example, 'Tomato Alla Vodka Cannellini Beans' specifies the flavor and type of bean, while 'Grilled Cheese Tomato Soup' indicates the flavor profile. rule.title: Use tabs or accordions for product details
rule.description: Product pages should use clickable tabs or accordions (e.g. Description, Reviews, Specifications) to reduce clutter, improve scannability, and make information easier to access.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The product pages on Heyday Canning Co.'s website do not utilize tabs or accordions for displaying product details. Instead, they present information in a continuous scroll format, which can lead to clutter and may make it harder for users to quickly find specific information. Implementing tabs or accordions for sections like 'Description', 'Reviews', and 'Specifications' would enhance scannability and improve the overall user experience.

Instead, it features a large hero image with the text "Hey, Dinner’s Almost Ready!" and a "Stock Your Pantry" button. Below this, there are sections introducing their soups and beans, but these sections do not highlight specific benefits near the product titles. rule.description: Product images should use consistent, clean backgrounds (e.g. white or light gray) to improve perceived professionalism and avoid visual distractions.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The product images on Heyday Canning Co's website do not consistently use clean, uniform backgrounds. Consistent use of white or light gray backgrounds across all product images would enhance the website's professionalism and visual appeal.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Estimated delivery times should be clearly displayed near the CTA using messages like "Order by X, get it by Y" to reduce uncertainty and prevent abandonment.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The homepage of Heyday Canning Co. does not display any clear call-to-action (CTA) buttons such as 'Shop Now' or 'Explore Collections'. To meet the rule, the website should include prominent CTAs and display estimated delivery times near these CTAs to reduce uncertainty.

rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The website uses pure black (#000000) for text and backgrounds, which can cause eye strain and reduce readability. For example, the navigation menu and footer have black text on a white background, and the footer has a black background with white text. To improve readability and create a more professional appearance, it's recommended to use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds.

rule.title: Enable lazy loading for images and videos
rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

expectedResult.reason: Rule failed because: The provided HTML content does not include any 'loading' attributes for images or videos, indicating that lazy loading is not implemented. Implementing lazy loading can improve page load times and performance by deferring the loading of images and videos until they enter the viewport. To comply with the rule, the website should add 'loading="lazy"' attributes to image and video tags, except for above-the-fold elements that must load immediately.

rule.title: Use descriptive and clear product titles
rule.description: Product titles should clearly describe the product using relevant attributes such as brand, size, color, and key characteristics. Titles should be concise, specific, and optimized for SEO (under ~65 characters).

expectedResult.reason: Rule passed because: The product titles on Allbirds' men's sneakers collection page are clear and descriptive, including the product type, material, color, and sole type. For example, 'Men’s Wool Runners – Natural Grey (Light Grey Sole)' and 'Men’s Tree Skippers – Kaikoura White (White Sole)' provide specific details about the product, adhering to the rule of using descriptive and clear product titles.

expectedResult.reason: The content does not include any breadcrumbs, which are essential for passing the rule. Breadcrumbs typically show the navigation path like 'Home / Category / Page' or similar formats. In this case, there is no visible breadcrumb trail mentioned in the KEY ELEMENTS section. Therefore, the rule fails because it specifically requires breadcrumbs to be present for it to pass. Additionally, there is no information about estimated delivery times near the CTA, which is another requirement of the rule.

rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

rule.title: Display breadcrumb navigation
rule.description: Breadcrumbs should be visible near the top of the product page to help users understand site hierarchy, navigate back to categories, and improve usability and SEO. Each breadcrumb should be clickable except the current product.

expectedResult.reason: The content does not include any breadcrumb navigation. Breadcrumbs are essential for helping users understand the site hierarchy and navigate back to categories. In the provided content, there is no mention of a breadcrumb trail like 'Home / Category / Page' or any similar format. Therefore, the rule is not met, and the evaluation fails.

rule.title: Show product ratings near title
rule.description: Product ratings should appear close to the product title and include both the average rating and total number of reviews. Clicking the rating should scroll users to the reviews section.

expectedResult.reason: The rule requires product ratings to be displayed near the product title, including both the average rating and total number of reviews, with a clickable element that scrolls users to the reviews section. However, the provided content does not include any information about product ratings or reviews. There are no elements such as stars, numerical ratings, or links to reviews present in the HTML content. Therefore, the rule is not met.

expectedResult.reason: The rule has passed because the KEY ELEMENTS section does not explicitly mention breadcrumbs, but the content includes a clear breadcrumb structure in the navigation. Additionally, the primary CTA (Call to Action) for purchasing products is expected to be visually prominent and placed above the fold, which is typically the case for e-commerce.

Therefore, the rule fails because the necessary lazy loading attributes are missing.

expectedResult.reason: The main Call to Action (CTA) buttons, such as 'Add to Cart' or 'Buy Now', are not clearly visible or prominent in the provided content. While there are product listings with prices and options to 'Shop Men' and 'Shop Women', the specific CTA buttons that would allow users to add items to their cart or purchase them are not highlighted or placed above the fold. For the rule to pass, the primary CTA should stand out visually, be easily accessible, and contrast clearly with the background, which,,

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Estimated delivery times should be clearly displayed near the CTA using messages like "Order by X, get it by Y" to reduce uncertainty and prevent abandonment.

expectedResult.reason: The rule requires that estimated delivery times should be clearly displayed near the call-to-action (CTA) buttons to reduce uncertainty and prevent cart abandonment. In the provided content, there is no mention of estimated delivery times or any specific messages like 'Order by X, get it by Y' near the CTAs. The only relevant information is about free shipping on orders over $75, but this does not fulfill the requirement for displaying shipping times. Therefore, the rule is not met.

rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: The rule specifically requires avoiding pure black (#000000) for text and backgrounds. However, the provided content does not explicitly mention any CSS styles or color codes used for text or backgrounds. Therefore, it cannot be determined if the rule is met or not. To pass this rule, the content should include specific color codes for text and backgrounds, ensuring that pure black is not used. Since this information is missing, the rule fails.

In the provided HTML content, there are no such attributes present for any images. Therefore, the rule is not met as lazy loading is not implemented.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Estimated delivery times should be clearly displayed near the CTA using messages like "Order by X, get it by Y" to reduce uncertainty and prevent abandonment.

expectedResult.reason: The content does not include any estimated delivery times near the call-to-action (CTA) buttons. The rule specifically requires messages like 'Order by X, get it by Y' to be displayed clearly near the CTA to reduce uncertainty and prevent abandonment. Since there are no such messages present in the provided content, the rule is not met.

rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: The webpage at https://www.allbirds.com/collections/mens-new-arrivals includes a breadcrumb trail: 'Home / Mens / New Arrivals', which clearly indicates the navigation path from the homepage to the men's new arrivals section. This breadcrumb trail meets the criteria for the rule, confirming that the rule is passed.

rule.title: Enable lazy loading for images and videos
rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

expectedResult.reason: The webpage at https://www.allbirds.com/collections/mens-new-arrivals includes breadcrumbs, which are navigation aids that show the user's current location within the website's hierarchy. The breadcrumbs displayed are: 'Home / Mens / New Arrivals'. This breadcrumb trail indicates the user's path from the homepage to the men's section and then to the new arrivals page, providing clear navigation context. Therefore, the rule is satisfied.

This breadcrumb trail helps users understand the site's hierarchy and navigate back to previous categories, thereby improving usability and SEO.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Estimated delivery times should be clearly displayed near the CTA using messages like "Order by X, get it by Y" to reduce uncertainty and prevent abandonment.

expectedResult.reason: The content does not display estimated delivery times near the call-to-action (CTA) buttons. rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: The content does not include any breadcrumb navigation, which is essential for this rule to pass. Breadcrumbs are navigation aids that display the user's current location within the website's hierarchy, typically in the format 'Home > Category > Page'. Their absence means the rule is not met.

rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

rule.title: Enable lazy loading for images and videos
rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

expectedResult.reason: The website at https://www.allbirds.com/collections/mens-new-arrivals implements lazy loading for images and videos. This is evident as images and videos load only when they enter the viewport, reducing initial page load time and improving performance. Additionally, above-the-fold images are not lazy-loaded, ensuring immediate loading for critical content. This approach aligns with the specified rule to enable lazy loading for images and videos, except for above-the-fold content.

rule.title: Display breadcrumb navigation
rule.description: Breadcrumbs should be visible near the top of the product page to help users understand site hierarchy, navigate back to categories, and improve usability and SEO. Each breadcrumb should be clickable except the current product.

expectedResult.reason: The breadcrumb navigation on the Allbirds Men's New Arrivals page is: 'Home / Men's / New Arrivals'. This breadcrumb trail is visible near the top of the product page, helping users understand the site hierarchy and navigate back to categories, thereby improving usability and SEO.

expectedResult.reason: The rule is PASSED because the website includes product ratings near the titles of the products. For example, the 'MEN'S VARSITY' product has a rating displayed near its title, indicating that product ratings are present as required by the rule.

expectedResult.reason: The website does not use pure black (#000000); instead, it employs softer dark tones, which aligns with the rule's requirements.

rule.title: Highlight key benefits near product title
rule.description: A short list of 2–3 key benefits should be displayed near the product title to quickly communicate value and capture attention. Benefits should be specific, impactful, and aligned with key selling points.

expectedResult.reason: The content does not include a short list of 2–3 key benefits near the product titles to quickly communicate value and capture attention. For example, the product titles like 'MEN'S VARSITY' and 'MEN'S TREE RUNNER NZ' are not accompanied by specific benefits such as 'Lightweight', 'Breathable', or 'Sustainable Materials'. Including such benefits near the product titles would enhance the content's effectiveness.

These visual elements help reduce uncertainty and increase buyer confidence.

expectedResult.reason: The content does not display estimated delivery times near the call-to-action (CTA) buttons. While the shipping policy mentions that orders placed before 12:30 pm ET on a business day will ship the same day, and that expedited orders placed before 12:30 pm ET on a business day will ship that same day, this information is not prominently displayed near the CTA buttons on the product page. rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: The Allbirds website does not use pure black (#000000) for text or backgrounds. Instead, it employs softer dark tones, such as #333333 for text and #121212 or #212121 for backgrounds, enhancing readability and reducing eye strain.

rule.title: Sticky Add to Cart button
rule.description: A sticky or floating Add to Cart button should remain visible when the main CTA scrolls out of view to reduce friction and keep users focused on the primary conversion goal.

expectedResult.reason: Allbirds' website features a sticky 'Add to Cart' button that remains visible as customers scroll through product pages, ensuring easy access to the cart at all times. This design enhances the shopping experience by reducing friction and encouraging immediate action. Additionally, the 'Add to Cart' button is strategically highlighted when selecting a size, prompting users to add items to their cart promptly. This feature, along with the sticky chat, significantly improves the shopping experience

rule.title: Use descriptive and clear product titles
rule.description: Product titles should clearly describe the product using relevant attributes such as brand, size, color, and key characteristics. Titles should be concise, specific, and optimized for SEO (under ~65 characters).

expectedResult.reason: Allbirds' product titles are descriptive and clear, effectively conveying key attributes such as brand, size, color, and key characteristics. For example, the 'Allbirds Men's Tree Runner Go - Utility - Natural Black/Dark Jungle (Natural White Sole)' title specifies the brand (Allbirds), product type (Men's Tree Runner Go), style (Utility), color (Natural Black/Dark Jungle), and sole color (Natural White Sole). This clarity aids customers in making informed purchasing decisions.

rule.title: Use square images for consistency
rule.description: All product images should use a 1:1 square aspect ratio to maintain visual consistency, prevent layout shifts, and improve the overall gallery appearance.

expectedResult.reason: Allbirds' product images do not consistently adhere to a 1:1 square aspect ratio. The homepage features product images with varying aspect ratios, including rectangular ones, which can lead to visual inconsistency and layout shifts. For example, the 'Men's Shoes' and 'Women's Shoes' sections display images that are not square. Implementing a uniform 1:1 aspect ratio for all product images would enhance visual consistency and improve the overall gallery appearance.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart or Buy Now) should stand out visually, be placed above the fold, and contrast clearly with the background.

expectedResult.reason: The primary Call-to-Action (CTA) buttons, such as 'Shop Men' and 'Shop Women', are not prominently displayed above the fold on the Allbirds homepage. Instead, the main focus is on the 'New Arrivals' and 'Bestsellers' sections, which are highlighted with large images and titles. The CTA buttons are located further down the page, making them less immediately accessible to users. rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: If applicable, the free shipping threshold should be clearly displayed near the main CTA to encourage higher order values.

expectedResult.reason: Allbirds offers free shipping on orders over $75, but this information is not prominently displayed near the main call-to-action (CTA) on their homepage. Instead, it's mentioned in the footer section, which may not be immediately visible to users. To encourage higher order values, it's recommended that Allbirds highlight the free shipping threshold near the main CTA, such as the 'Shop Men' and 'Shop Women' buttons, to make this offer more visible and enticing to customers.

rule.title: Display trust signals near the CTA
rule.description: Security badges and payment logos should be positioned near the Add to Cart or Checkout buttons to reassure users and reduce hesitation.

expectedResult.reason: The Allbirds website does not display security badges or payment logos near the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. These trust signals are typically placed near critical conversion points to reassure customers about the security of their transactions. Their absence may lead to hesitation during the checkout process. ([vareweb.com](https://vareweb.com/blog/what-trust-badges-mean-and-why-they-are-important/?utm_source=openai))

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Estimated delivery times should be clearly displayed near the CTA using messages like "Order by X, get it by Y" to reduce uncertainty and prevent abandonment.

expectedResult.reason: Allbirds' website does not display estimated delivery times near the call-to-action (CTA) buttons. While the shipping policy provides details on shipping options and delivery times, this information is not prominently featured near the CTAs, such as 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. Displaying messages like 'Order by X, get it by Y' near these CTAs can help reduce uncertainty and prevent cart abandonment.

rule.title: Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds
rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: The website uses pure black (#000000) for text and backgrounds, which violates the rule to avoid pure black. For example, the 'Sign In' and 'Bag' buttons have the class 'cls-1' with the style 'fill:none;stroke:#010101;stroke-miterlimit:10;stroke-width:0.75px;', where '#010101' is effectively pure black. To comply with the rule, the website should use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds.

rule.title: Enable lazy loading for images and videos
rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

expectedResult.reason: The website eastlandshoe.com does not implement lazy loading for images and videos. All media elements are loaded immediately upon page load, regardless of their visibility in the user's viewport. This approach can lead to longer initial page load times and increased bandwidth usage, negatively impacting performance. Implementing lazy loading would defer the loading of off-screen images and videos until they are about to enter the viewport, thereby improving page load times and overall user-expe

rule.title: Sticky Add to Cart button
rule.description: A sticky or floating Add to Cart button should remain visible when the main CTA scrolls out of view to reduce friction and keep users focused on the primary conversion goal.

expectedResult.reason: The website does not feature a sticky or floating 'Add to Cart' button that remains visible when the main call-to-action (CTA) scrolls out of view. Implementing a sticky 'Add to Cart' button would enhance user experience by keeping the purchase option readily accessible, thereby reducing the likelihood of cart abandonment.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: The most commonly chosen size or color should be preselected to reduce friction and speed up the purchasing process.

expectedResult.reason: The website uses pure black (#000000) in its design, which violates the rule to avoid pure black. For example, the navigation menu items such as 'Women's Shoes', 'Men's Shoes', 'Kids' Shoes', 'Our Brands', and 'Sale' are displayed in pure black text. Additionally, the 'Sign In' and 'Bag' buttons are outlined in pure black. To comply with the rule, these elements should be displayed in softer dark tones like #333333, #121212, or #212121.

expectedResult.reason: Product ratings are not displayed near the product title 'Astro Dust - Starter Kit'. While a rating of '4.5 out of 5' and 'Excellent' is present, the total number of reviews is missing, and the rating is not clickable to the reviews section. Both review count and a clickable link are required.

rule.title: Use descriptive and clear product titles

expectedResult.reason: The product title 'Astro Dust - Starter Kit' is too generic. It should include more descriptive attributes like brand and key characteristics to be SEO-optimized and clearly describe the product. Consider adding 'Spacegoods Astro Dust Starter Kit for Sleep' for better clarity and searchability.

expectedResult.reason: Pure black (#000000) is used for the text 'Skip to Main content' in the header. This should be a softer dark tone like #333333 for better readability and reduced eye strain.

rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: No pure black (#000000) detected for text or backgrounds. Elements like 'Delivering to Mohali 160055' and navigation links use appropriate dark tones, adhering to the rule.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found. The page lacks a section comparing the primary product with 2-3 alternatives across 4+ attributes in a table format, which is required by the product-comparison rule.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found. The page lacks a section comparing the primary product with 2-3 alternatives across 4+ attributes in a table format, which is required by the product-comparison rule.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found. The page lacks a section comparing the primary product with 2-3 alternatives across 4+ attributes in a table format, which is required by the product-comparison rule.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The page does not preselect the most common variant. The color options 'Blue', 'Black', 'Grey', 'Orange', and 'Red' are displayed, but none are visually highlighted as the default or most common choice, and the 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not prominent. It is not visible above the fold and does not use a high-contrast color. It is also smaller than other elements like the product title.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: No 'Add to Cart' button found on the page. The free shipping threshold rule requires a CTA button to check proximity and language.

Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. expectedResult.reason: Shipping time information is not visible near the CTA. The page lacks a countdown/cutoff time and a specific delivery date directly above or below the 'Add to Cart' or 'Buy Now' buttons, failing to meet the rule's requirements.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' and 'Buy Now' buttons are not prominent. They are not the visual focal point, are not above the fold, and do not use high-contrast colors. The 'Add to Cart' button is a ghost button.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The page does not display any free shipping threshold message near the 'Add to Cart' button. The 'Add to Cart' button is not visible in the provided content, and therefore proximity and language checks cannot be performed.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 alternatives in a table format, detailing 4+ attributes. This section is missing.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The page fails to preselect the most common variant. The color options 'Blue', 'Black', 'Grey', 'Orange', and 'Red' are displayed, but none are visually highlighted as the default or most common selection. The 'Add to Cart' button is not immediately available without a selection.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The main CTA 'Add to Cart' is not visible above the fold. It is located below the product description and alternative items, making it less prominent than other elements.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: No 'Add to Cart' button found. The free shipping threshold rule requires a CTA button to evaluate proximity and language. Please ensure the product page has an 'Add to Cart' button.

rule.title: Display trust signals near the CTA
rule.description: Security badges and payment logos (SSL, Visa, PayPal, Money-back Guarantee) must be positioned within 50px of the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. These signals must be visible without scrolling and should use high-quality, muted or monochromatic designs so their visual weight is lower than the main CTA to avoid distraction.

expectedResult.reason: No trust signals (SSL, payment logos, security badges) are found near the CTA. Trust badges must be within 50px of the CTA and visible without scrolling to build user confidence.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any offers like 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free' or tiered pricing for multiple units. Standard pricing is shown.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping information is not visible near the CTA. The page displays 'Delivering to Mohali 160055 Update location' but lacks a countdown/cutoff time and a specific delivery date directly above or below the 'Add to Cart' or 'Buy Now' button.

rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

rule.description: A sticky or floating Add to Cart button should remain visible when the main CTA scrolls out of view to reduce friction and keep users focused on the primary conversion goal.

rule.title: Show product ratings near title
rule.description: Product ratings should appear close to the product title and include both the average rating and total number of reviews. Clicking the rating should scroll users to the reviews section.

expectedResult.reason: Product ratings are missing near the product title. The page does not display a review score (e.g., '4.5 stars'), a review count (e.g., '203 reviews'), or a clickable link to the reviews section. This fails the social proof requirement of showing ratings close to the title.

rule.title: Use descriptive and clear product titles
rule.description: Product titles should clearly describe the product using relevant attributes such as brand, size, color, and key characteristics. Titles should be concise, specific, and optimized for SEO (under ~65 characters).

expectedResult.reason: The product title 'Pure black (#000000)' is not descriptive. It lacks brand, model, or key features, making it unclear what the product is. It should include specific attributes to be easily understood and optimized for search.

rule.title: Use tabs or accordions for product details
rule.description: Product pages should use clickable tabs or accordions (e.g. Description, Reviews, Specifications) to reduce clutter, improve scannability, and make information easier to access.

expectedResult.reason: Product details are presented as a long, continuous block of text instead of using tabs or accordions. This makes it harder for users to find specific information like 'Product description', 'Technical details', or 'Customer reviews'.

rule.title: Highlight key benefits near product title
rule.description: A short list of 2–3 key benefits should be displayed near the product title to quickly communicate value and capture attention. Benefits should be specific, impactful, and aligned with key selling points.

expectedResult.reason: The product title 'HP Smart Tank 720 All-in-One Printer' is too generic. It lacks key characteristics like color, connectivity options (e.g., Wi-Fi, USB), or specific benefits (e.g., 'high-volume printing', 'automatic document feeder'). The title should be descriptive on its own for SEO and clarity, located in the product page header.

rule.title: Include annotations in product images
rule.description: Product images should include annotations or badges highlighting key benefits or differentiators to visually communicate value faster than text alone.

expectedResult.reason: Product images lack annotations. Key benefits like 'Waterproof' or 'Long Battery Life' are not visually highlighted on the main product images, slowing down value communication. Add badges or text overlays to images.

rule.title: Show thumbnails in product image gallery
rule.description: The product gallery should include visible thumbnails to allow users to quickly browse all images without excessive scrolling.

expectedResult.reason: Product image gallery is missing thumbnails. Users cannot easily browse all images without scrolling. Add visible thumbnails next to the main image for better navigation.

rule.title: Use square images for consistency
rule.description: All product images should use a 1:1 square aspect ratio to maintain visual consistency, prevent layout shifts, and improve the overall gallery appearance.

expectedResult.reason: The main product image, located in the 'Product Images' section at the top of the page, is not a square. It appears to be wider than it is tall. To ensure visual consistency, this image should be cropped or resized to a 1:1 aspect ratio.

rule.title: Show product from multiple angles
rule.description: Product images should display multiple angles and close-ups, and include contextual or scale references where relevant, to reduce uncertainty and increase buyer confidence.

expectedResult.reason: The product images lack multiple angles and close-ups. Only one primary image is visible, failing to show different sides or detailed views of the product, which is crucial for buyer confidence.

rule.title: Focus on benefits in product descriptions
rule.description: Product descriptions should emphasize how features translate into customer benefits, helping users understand how the product improves their life or solves a problem.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a clear, scannable comparison of the primary product with 2-3 alternatives across 4+ attributes in a table format.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The page does not appear to have variant options like size or color that require preselection. The 'Add to Cart' button is available without explicit variant selection, indicating no variant preselection rule violation.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. rule.title: Display trust signals near the CTA
rule.description: Security badges and payment logos (SSL, Visa, PayPal, Money-back Guarantee) must be positioned within 50px of the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. These signals must be visible without scrolling and should use high-quality, muted or monochromatic designs so their visual weight is lower than the main CTA to avoid distraction.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units, such as 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free' or tiered pricing. No general product discounts like percentage off or price drops are visible.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping info not near CTA. CTA 'Add to Cart' is visible, but no dynamic delivery estimate with countdown/cutoff time and specific date is directly above or below it. FAIL.

rule.title: Display breadcrumb navigation
rule.description: Breadcrumbs should be visible near the top of the product page to help users understand site hierarchy, navigate back to categories, and improve usability and SEO. Each breadcrumb should be clickable except the current product.

expectedResult.reason: Breadcrumbs are not found on the page. This makes it difficult for users to understand their current location within the site hierarchy and navigate back to previous categories, impacting usability and SEO.

rule.title: Show product ratings near title
rule.description: Product ratings should appear close to the product title and include both the average rating and total number of reviews. Clicking the rating should scroll users to the reviews section.

expectedResult.reason: Product ratings are missing near the product title. The page does not display a review score (e.g., '4.5/5') or a review count (e.g., '203 reviews'), nor is there a clickable link to a reviews section. This fails to provide social proof near the product title.

rule.title: Use descriptive and clear product titles
rule.description: Product titles should clearly describe the product using relevant attributes such as brand, size, color, and key characteristics. Titles should be concise, specific, and optimized for SEO (under ~65 characters).

expectedResult.reason: The product title 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit' is clear and descriptive, accurately reflecting the product's content and purpose. It is concise and suitable for SEO.

rule.title: Use tabs or accordions for product details
rule.description: Product pages should use clickable tabs or accordions (e.g. Description, Reviews, Specifications) to reduce clutter, improve scannability, and make information easier to access.

expectedResult.reason: The page uses collapsible accordions for product details, including sections like 'Product Details', 'Ingredients', and 'How to Use', which effectively organize information.

rule.title: Highlight key benefits near product title
rule.description: A short list of 2–3 key benefits should be displayed near the product title to quickly communicate value and capture attention. Benefits should be specific, impactful, and aligned with key selling points.

expectedResult.reason: The product title 'Rainbow Dust - Starter Kit' is too generic. It lacks key attributes like size, color, or specific benefits. The title should be descriptive on its own for SEO and clarity, even though a description section exists. It's located in the product page header.

rule.title: Maintain consistent image backgrounds
rule.description: Product images should use consistent, clean backgrounds (e.g. white or light gray) to improve perceived professionalism and avoid visual distractions.

expectedResult.reason: The main product image for 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit' has a busy, multi-colored background that is inconsistent with a clean, professional look. This distracts from the product itself. Backgrounds should be a solid, light color like white or light gray.

rule.title: Focus on benefits in product descriptions
rule.description: Product descriptions should emphasize how features translate into customer benefits, helping users understand how the product improves their life or solves a problem.

expectedResult.reason: The product description for 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit' focuses heavily on features like '100% natural ingredients' and 'easy to use' without clearly explaining the resulting benefits for the customer. It should elaborate on how these features improve their experience or solve a problem.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 alternatives in a table format, detailing 4+ attributes. This section is missing.

rule.title: Show customer photos using the product
rule.description: Real customer photos should be featured on the product page to increase social proof, authenticity, and buyer confidence.

expectedResult.reason: Customer photos are displayed in the 'Reviews with images' section. These are customer-uploaded photos showing the product, which fulfills the requirement for showing customer photos using the product.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials with play buttons were found within customer review cards or dedicated video testimonial sections on the page. Product gallery videos or promotional videos do not count.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit' product page does not preselect a variant. Users must manually select a color before they can add the product to their cart, failing the 'Preselect the most common variant' rule. The color options are not visually highlighted as preselected on page load.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button with a thin border and blends into the background, failing to meet the high-contrast requirement. It should be a solid, high-contrast color and larger than secondary buttons.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: Free shipping threshold message is not visible near the CTA. The 'Add to Cart' button is present, but no free shipping threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' is displayed within 50-100 pixels above or below it. Information is missing near the CTA.

rule.title: Display trust signals near the CTA
rule.description: Security badges and payment logos (SSL, Visa, PayPal, Money-back Guarantee) must be positioned within 50px of the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. These signals must be visible without scrolling and should use high-quality, muted or monochromatic designs so their visual weight is lower than the main CTA to avoid distraction.

expectedResult.reason: No trust signals (SSL, payment logos, security badges) are visible within 50px of the 'Add to Cart' button. Trust badges must be near the CTA to reassure users.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The product page does not display any specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units, such as 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free' or tiered pricing. Standard pricing is shown without any bulk offers.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping time information is not displayed near the CTA. The page lacks a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or specific delivery date directly above or below the 'Add to Cart' button.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 alternatives in a table format, detailing 4+ attributes. This is missing.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials found. The page lacks sections titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or 'Video Reviews', and no video players with play buttons are visible within customer review cards or blocks.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Red' color variant is preselected by default, indicated by a visual highlight. Users can add this variant to the cart without further selection.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button, which lacks contrast and visual weight, failing to draw immediate attention as the primary CTA. It should be a solid, high-contrast button placed above the fold.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: Free shipping information is not visible near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page needs a message like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' within 50-100px of the CTA.

rule.description: Security badges and payment logos (SSL, Visa, PayPal, Money-back Guarantee) must be positioned within 200px of the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The product page does not display any offers like 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing, or bundle deals. General discounts or coupon codes are also absent.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping time information is not displayed near the CTA. The page lacks a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or specific delivery date in proximity to the 'Add to Cart' button, failing to meet the 'shipping-time-visibility' rule.

rule.description: Pure black (#000000) should not be used for text or backgrounds. Use softer dark tones like #333333 for text and dark gray (#121212 or #212121) for backgrounds to improve readability, reduce eye strain, and create a more professional appearance.

expectedResult.reason: No pure black (#000000) was detected for text or backgrounds. The site uses a dark gray for text and a white background, adhering to the 'Avoid pure black for text and backgrounds' rule.

rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 alternatives in a table format, detailing at least 4 attributes. This section is missing, hindering informed decision-making.

rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials found. The page lacks sections titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or 'Video Reviews', and no video players with play buttons are visible within customer review cards or blocks.

rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button, which is not visually distinct and lacks a high-contrast color, failing to meet the prominence requirement for the main CTA.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: Free shipping information is not visible near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page lacks a clear threshold message within 50-100 pixels of the CTA. Consider adding text like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' directly above or below the button.

rule.title: Display trust signals near the CTA
rule.description: Security badges and payment logos (SSL, Visa, PayPal, Money-back Guarantee) must be positioned within 200px of the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. These signals must be visible without scrolling and should use high-quality, muted or monochromatic designs so their visual weight is lower than the main CTA to avoid distraction.

expectedResult.reason: Payment badges (e.g. Visa, Mastercard, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay) are present on the page, providing trust signals for users.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any 'Buy X Get Y Free', tiered pricing, or bundle offers for this product. To pass, add specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping time visibility rule failed. CTA 'Add to Cart' is present, but no dynamic delivery estimate (countdown/cutoff time and specific delivery date) is displayed near it. This is crucial for managing customer expectations and reducing friction.

rule.title: Enable lazy loading for images and videos
rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

expectedResult.reason: Images without lazy loading: The main product image for 'Rainbow Dust - Starter Kit' (found in the product gallery section) is missing the loading='lazy' attribute. Images in the 'POPULAR PRODUCTS' section also lack lazy loading. These should be lazy-loaded to improve initial page load time.

rule.title: Display breadcrumb navigation
rule.description: Breadcrumbs should be visible near the top of the product page to help users understand site hierarchy, navigate back to categories, and improve usability and SEO. Each breadcrumb should be clickable except the current product.

expectedResult.reason: Breadcrumbs are not found on the page. This makes it difficult for users to understand their current location within the site hierarchy and navigate back to previous categories, impacting usability and SEO.

rule.title: Sticky Add to Cart button
rule.description: A sticky or floating Add to Cart button should remain visible when the main CTA scrolls out of view to reduce friction and keep users focused on the primary conversion goal.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button in the main product section disappears when scrolling down and does not remain sticky or floating. It is only visible when scrolling to the bottom of the page.

rule.title: Show product ratings near title
rule.description: Product ratings should appear close to the product title and include both the average rating and total number of reviews. Clicking the rating should scroll users to the reviews section.

expectedResult.reason: Product ratings are missing near the product title. The page does not display a review score (e.g., '4.5/5') or a review count (e.g., '203 reviews'), nor is there a clickable link to a reviews section. This fails to provide social proof near the product title.

rule.description: Product titles should clearly describe the product using relevant attributes such as brand, size, color, and key characteristics. Titles should be concise, specific, and optimized for SEO (under ~65 characters).

expectedResult.reason: The product title 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit' is clear and descriptive, accurately reflecting the product's content and purpose. It is concise and suitable for SEO.

expectedResult.reason: The page uses collapsible accordions for product details, including sections like 'Product Details', 'Ingredients', and 'How to Use', which effectively organize information.

rule.title: Highlight key benefits near product title
rule.description: A short list of 2–3 key benefits should be displayed near the product title to quickly communicate value and capture attention. Benefits should be specific, impactful, and aligned with key selling points.

expectedResult.reason: The product title 'Rainbow Dust - Starter Kit' is too generic. It lacks key attributes like size, color, or specific benefits. The title should be descriptive on its own for SEO and clarity, even though a description section exists. It's located in the product page header.

rule.description: All product images should use a 1:1 square aspect ratio to maintain visual consistency, prevent layout shifts, and improve the overall gallery appearance.

expectedResult.reason: The main product image, located in the product gallery at the top of the page, is not a square. It appears to be wider than it is tall, which violates the requirement for 1:1 aspect ratio images for consistency.

rule.title: Maintain consistent image backgrounds
rule.description: Product images should use consistent, clean backgrounds (e.g. white or light gray) to improve perceived professionalism and avoid visual distractions.

expectedResult.reason: The main product image for 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit' has a busy, multi-colored background that is inconsistent with a clean, professional look. This distracts from the product itself. Backgrounds should be a solid, light color like white or light gray.

rule.title: Focus on benefits in product descriptions
rule.description: Product descriptions should emphasize how features translate into customer benefits, helping users understand how the product improves their life or solves a problem.

expectedResult.reason: The product description for 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit' focuses heavily on features like '100% natural ingredients' and 'easy to use' without clearly explaining the resulting benefits for the customer. It should elaborate on how these features improve their experience or solve a problem.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 alternatives in a table format, detailing 4+ attributes. This section is missing.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials with play buttons were found within customer review cards or dedicated video testimonial sections on the page. Product gallery videos or promotional videos do not count.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit' product page does not preselect a variant. Users must manually select a color before they can add the product to their cart, failing the 'Preselect the most common variant' rule. The color options are not visually highlighted as preselected on page load.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button with a thin border and blends into the background, failing to meet the high-contrast requirement. It should be a solid, high-contrast color and larger than secondary buttons.
