rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: Free shipping threshold message is not visible near the CTA. The 'Add to Cart' button is present, but no free shipping threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' is displayed within 50-100 pixels above or below it. Information is missing near the CTA.

rule.title: Display trust signals near the CTA
rule.description: Security badges and payment logos (SSL, Visa, PayPal, Money-back Guarantee) must be positioned within 200px of the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. These signals must be visible without scrolling and should use high-quality, muted or monochromatic designs so their visual weight is lower than the main CTA to avoid distraction.

expectedResult.reason: No trust signals (SSL, payment logos, security badges) are visible near the 'Add to Cart' button. Trust badges must be within 50px of the CTA and visible without scrolling to reassure users.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The product page does not display any specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units, such as 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free' or tiered pricing. Standard pricing is shown without any bulk offers.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping time information is not displayed near the CTA. The page lacks a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or specific delivery date directly above or below the 'Add to Cart' button.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 alternatives in a table format, detailing at least 4 attributes. This section is missing, hindering informed decision-making.

Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button, which is not visually distinct and lacks a high-contrast color, failing to meet the prominence requirement for the main CTA.

It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any 'Buy X Get Y Free', tiered pricing, or bundle offers for this product. To pass, add specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping time visibility rule failed. CTA 'Add to Cart' is present, but no dynamic delivery estimate (countdown/cutoff time and specific delivery date) is displayed near it. This is crucial for managing customer expectations and reducing friction.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives in a table format, detailing at least 4 attributes. This section is missing entirely.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials found. The page lacks videos within customer review cards or dedicated 'Video Testimonials' sections, which are required to build trust and engagement.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The product page loads with the '30ml' variant preselected, indicated by the 'active' class on the button. Users can add to cart immediately.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button, lacks high contrast, and is not visually distinct from other elements, failing to meet the prominence requirement for the main CTA.

It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The product page does not display any offers like 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing, or percentage savings for purchasing multiple units. To pass, add specific financial incentives for bulk purchases.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping time information is not displayed near the CTA. The page lacks a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or cutoff time and a specific delivery date directly above or below the 'Add to Cart' button.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison with 2-3 alternatives, 4+ attributes, and a table format to help users make informed decisions.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials found. The page lacks sections titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or 'Video Reviews', and no video players with play buttons are visible within review sections. To pass, add videos from customers within review cards or dedicated testimonial sections.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The page does not contain product variants or options that require preselection. Therefore, the 'variant-preselection' rule is not applicable and is considered passed.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: No primary CTA like 'Add to Cart' or 'Buy Now' found on the page. The page is a tutorial overview, not a product page, so this rule is not applicable.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: No 'Add to Cart' button or free shipping threshold message found on the page. The rule requires a CTA button and a free shipping incentive message within 50-100 pixels above or below it, using specific threshold language.

rule.title: Display trust signals near the CTA
rule.description: Security badges and payment logos (SSL, Visa, PayPal, Money-back Guarantee) must be positioned within 200px of the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. These signals must be visible without scrolling and should use high-quality, muted or monochromatic designs so their visual weight is lower than the main CTA to avoid distraction.

expectedResult.reason: No payment or trust badges (SSL, Visa, PayPal, etc.) are visible near the CTA. The page content does not show any trust signals in the product or checkout area to reassure users.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units or bundles, such as 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free' or tiered pricing. General single-item discounts or sitewide sales are not applicable to this rule.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: CTA not found on the page. Cannot evaluate shipping time visibility near CTA as per the rule's requirements.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives in a table format, detailing at least 4 attributes. This section is missing entirely.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials found. The page lacks videos within customer review cards or dedicated 'Video Testimonials' sections, which are required to build trust and engagement.

The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button, lacks high contrast, and is not visually distinct from other elements, failing to meet the prominence requirement for the main CTA.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: Free shipping information is not visible near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page lacks a clear threshold message within 50-100 pixels of the CTA, such as 'Add $X more for Free Shipping'.

These signals must be visible without scrolling and should use high-quality, muted or monochromatic designs so their visual weight is lower than the main CTA to avoid distraction.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The product page does not display any offers like 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing, or percentage savings for purchasing multiple units. To pass, add specific financial incentives for bulk purchases.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping time information is not displayed near the CTA. The page lacks a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or cutoff time and a specific delivery date directly above or below the 'Add to Cart' button.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a clear, scannable section comparing the primary product with 2-3 alternatives across 4+ attributes in a table format.

rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials found. The page lacks sections titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or 'Video Reviews', and no video players or thumbnails are present within customer review cards or sections.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The page does not visually highlight any default variant selection. It's unclear if a variant is preselected or if the 'Add to Cart' button is enabled without selection. The HTML lacks elements to determine variant preselection or visual highlighting.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The main CTA 'Add to Cart' button is not visible above the fold. Its color and size cannot be assessed without it being present and prominent. Ensure the primary CTA is the visual focal point.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: The primary Call to Action (CTA) button, such as 'Add to Cart' or 'Buy Now', could not be located in the provided HTML content. Without the CTA, it's impossible to verify if shipping time information is displayed nearby, as required by the rule.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a comparison of the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives in a table format, detailing at least 4 attributes. This section is missing entirely.

rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials found. The page lacks videos within customer review cards or dedicated 'Video Testimonials' sections, which are required to build trust and engagement.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The product page loads with the '30ml' variant preselected, indicated by the 'active' class on the button. Users can add to cart immediately.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button, lacks high contrast, and is not visually distinct from other elements, failing to meet the prominence requirement for the main CTA.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA

It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The product page does not display any offers like 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing, or percentage savings for purchasing multiple units. To pass, add specific financial incentives for bulk purchases.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping time information is not displayed near the CTA. The page lacks a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or cutoff time and a specific delivery date directly above or below the 'Add to Cart' button.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a clear, scannable product comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives across at least 4 meaningful attributes in a side-by-side table format.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials found within customer review cards or dedicated video testimonial sections. The 'Customer Reviews' section lacks any embedded videos with play buttons. Add videos from real customers within review blocks to increase trust.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: The product page loads with the '30ml' variant preselected, as indicated by the title. The 'Add to Cart' button is immediately available, allowing purchase without further selection.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not the most prominent element. It is a ghost button with a thin border, blending into the background, and is not a high-contrast color. It should be a solid, vibrant color and larger than other elements to be the primary focal point.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button was not found in the provided content, making it impossible to verify proximity or content of any free shipping threshold message. The rule requires the message to be near the CTA. Please ensure the CTA is present and check for shipping threshold language within 50-100px above or below it.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display specific financial incentives like 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing, or percentage savings for purchasing multiple units. General single-item discounts or free shipping alone do not qualify.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping information with a countdown or specific delivery date is not visible near the 'Add to Cart' button. The rule requires a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') to be placed directly above or below the CTA.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: No variant is preselected by default. The 'Add to Cart' button is likely disabled until a size is chosen from the dropdown menu located below the product title.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is large, uses a primary class, and is clearly visible without scrolling, making it the most prominent element in the product section.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: Free shipping information is not displayed near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page lacks a message with threshold language (e.g., 'Add $X more for Free Shipping') within 50-100 pixels above or below the CTA, failing to encourage higher order values.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units, such as 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing, or percentage savings for bulk purchases.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping information is missing near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page does not display a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or specific cutoff time, nor does it provide a specific delivery date. This fails to meet the rule's requirements for managing customer expectations upfront.

rule.description: Images and videos should load only when they enter the viewport to reduce initial page load time and improve performance. Do not lazy load above-the-fold images, as they must load immediately.

expectedResult.reason: Main product image (rainbow-dust-starter-kit.webp) and all thumbnail gallery images lack the loading='lazy' attribute. These should be lazy-loaded to improve initial page load time.

rule.title: Display breadcrumb navigation
rule.description: Breadcrumbs should be visible near the top of the product page to help users understand site hierarchy, navigate back to categories, and improve usability and SEO. Each breadcrumb should be clickable except the current product.

expectedResult.reason: Breadcrumb navigation is not found on the page. To improve usability and SEO, add a breadcrumb trail near the top of the page, showing the user's path from the homepage to the current product.

rule.title: Sticky Add to Cart button
rule.description: A sticky or floating Add to Cart button should remain visible when the main CTA scrolls out of view to reduce friction and keep users focused on the primary conversion goal.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button in the main product section is not sticky. It disappears when scrolling down the page and does not remain visible to the user, failing to meet the sticky button requirement.

rule.title: Show product ratings near title
rule.description: Product ratings should appear close to the product title and include both the average rating and total number of reviews. Clicking the rating should scroll users to the reviews section.

expectedResult.reason: Product ratings are shown near the title with a score ('★★★★☆') and count ('123 reviews'), but the rating element is not clickable to scroll users to the reviews section. The link to reviews is a required component for this rule.

rule.title: Use tabs or accordions for product details
rule.description: Product pages should use clickable tabs or accordions (e.g. Description, Reviews, Specifications) to reduce clutter, improve scannability, and make information easier to access.

expectedResult.reason: The page uses collapsible accordions for product details, including sections for 'Product Details', 'Ingredients', 'How to Use', 'Shipping & Delivery', and 'Return & Refund Policy', which organizes information effectively.

rule.title: Highlight key benefits near product title
rule.description: A short list of 2–3 key benefits should be displayed near the product title to quickly communicate value and capture attention. Benefits should be specific, impactful, and aligned with key selling points.

expectedResult.reason: Key benefits like 'Reveal radiant skin', 'Fades dark spots fast', 'Evens skin tone', and 'Glows with natural radiance' are listed directly below the product title 'Rainbow Dust Starter Kit', fulfilling the rule.

rule.title: Focus on benefits in product descriptions
rule.description: Product descriptions should emphasize how features translate into customer benefits, helping users understand how the product improves their life or solves a problem.

expectedResult.reason: The product description in the 'Product Description' section lists features like '50ml Bottle of Rainbow Dust Cleaner' and 'Microfibre Cloth' but fails to explain the customer benefits of these items. It does not describe how the product improves the user's life or solves a problem.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a clear, scannable section comparing the primary product with 2-3 alternatives across at least 4 attributes in a side-by-side table format.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials were found in the screenshot or page content. The 'Reviews' section does not contain any videos or play buttons within customer review cards or dedicated video testimonial sections.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: No variant is preselected on page load. Users must manually select 'Small' or 'Large' before the 'Add to Cart' button is enabled, failing the rule.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not prominent. It is a ghost button with a thin border, lacks high contrast against the white background, and is not visually dominant over other elements. It also uses pure black (#000000) for its text, which fails the color sub-rule.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: No free shipping message is displayed within 50-100 pixels of the 'Add to Cart' button. The page must include threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' directly above or below the CTA.

rule.title: Display trust signals near the CTA
rule.description: Security badges and payment logos (SSL, Visa, PayPal, Money-back Guarantee) must be positioned within 200px of the 'Add to Cart' or 'Checkout' buttons. These signals must be visible without scrolling and should use high-quality, muted or monochromatic designs so their visual weight is lower than the main CTA to avoid distraction.

expectedResult.reason: Payment method logos (Visa, Mastercard, American Express, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay) are displayed below the 'Add to Cart' button and shipping information, meeting the trust signal requirement.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units, such as 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free' or tiered pricing. General single-item discounts or sitewide sales are also absent.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping information is missing near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page lacks a countdown or cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within X hours') and a specific delivery date (e.g., 'Get it by Y date'), which are required to be displayed directly above or below the CTA.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a clear, scannable section comparing the primary product with 2-3 alternatives across 4+ attributes in a table format.

rule.title: Add video testimonials
rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials were found within customer review cards or dedicated video testimonial sections in the provided screenshot. Customer reviews section lacks videos.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: No variant is preselected by default. The 'Add to Cart' button is likely disabled until a size is chosen from the dropdown menu located below the product title.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not prominent. It is a ghost button (transparent with a border) and does not stand out visually against the background. It should be a solid, high-contrast color and larger than other elements to be the primary focal point.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: Free shipping information is not displayed near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page lacks a message with threshold language (e.g., 'Add $X more for Free Shipping') within 50-100 pixels above or below the CTA, failing to encourage higher order values.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units, such as 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing, or percentage savings for bulk purchases.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping information is missing near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page does not display a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or specific cutoff time, nor does it provide a specific delivery date. This fails to meet the rule's requirements for managing customer expectations upfront.

rule.title: Include a product comparison section
rule.description: The product page must include a comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives. The comparison must: 1. Identify 2-3 similar alternatives. 2. Compare 4+ technical or functional attributes (e.g., RAM, Battery, Price, Features). 3. Use a scannable table format. 4. Explicitly highlight the 'Winner' or 'Unique Value' for the primary product. 5. Be objective yet persuasive to reduce decision fatigue. The comparison should show why the primary product is the best choice while being honest about alternatives.

expectedResult.reason: No product comparison section found on the page. The rule requires a clear, scannable product comparison section that compares the primary product with 2-3 similar alternatives across at least 4 meaningful attributes in a side-by-side table format.

rule.description: Video testimonials from real customers must be included on the product page to increase trust, engagement, and conversion rates. A video testimonial must: 1. Include a visible play button (e.g., play icon overlay, YouTube embed with play button). 2. Be located within customer review cards, testimonial sections, or sections explicitly titled 'Video Testimonials', 'Customer Videos', or similar. 3. Feature real customers speaking about their experience with the product. Product gallery videos, product demos, or promotional videos do NOT count as customer testimonials.

expectedResult.reason: No video testimonials were found in the customer review section or any dedicated video testimonial sections. To pass, include videos from real customers within review cards or sections titled 'Video Testimonials'.

rule.title: Preselect the most common variant
rule.description: Ensure the most popular size, color, or configuration is selected by default when the page loads. The preselected variant must be clearly highlighted visually (e.g., bold border, darker color, selected state) and allow users to click 'Add to Cart' immediately without selecting a variant first. If 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is selected, or all variant options look the same on page load, the rule fails.

expectedResult.reason: No variant is preselected on page load. The 'Add to Cart' button is disabled until a variant is chosen. The available variant '30ml' is not visually highlighted as selected by default.

rule.title: Make the main CTA the most prominent element
rule.description: The primary CTA (Add to Cart/Buy Now) must be the visual focal point. It must be placed 'above the fold' (visible without scrolling), use a high-contrast color against the background (e.g., solid electric blue on white), be larger than secondary buttons, and use clear action-oriented text. Ghost buttons (transparent with thin borders) that blend into the background do NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: The 'Add to Cart' button is not prominent. It uses a muted grey color and is not visually distinct from other elements, failing to be the focal point. It should have a high-contrast, solid color and be larger than secondary buttons.

rule.title: Highlight free shipping threshold near CTA
rule.description: Display the free shipping incentive in the immediate eye-path of the CTA. It must be located within 50-100 pixels of the main 'Add to Cart' button (directly above or below), use persuasive threshold language like 'Add $X more for Free Shipping' or 'Free shipping over $50', and be clear and readable without being more distracting than the main CTA. Shipping information only in header banners or page footer does NOT meet this requirement.

expectedResult.reason: Free shipping information is not displayed near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page lacks a message with threshold language (e.g., 'Add $X more for Free Shipping') within 50-100 pixels above or below the CTA, failing to encourage higher order values.

rule.title: Offer quantity or bulk discounts
rule.description: Product pages must display specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units of the same product or bundles. Valid examples include 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing (e.g., $10 each for 5+ units), or 'Save 10% when you buy 3'. General single-item discounts, sitewide sales, or 'Free Shipping' do not qualify.

expectedResult.reason: No quantity or bulk discounts detected. The page does not display any specific financial incentives for purchasing multiple units, such as 'Buy 2 Get 1 Free', tiered pricing, or percentage savings for bulk purchases.

rule.title: Display shipping time near CTA
rule.description: Ensure a dynamic delivery estimate (e.g., 'Order within X hours, get it by Y date') is placed in immediate proximity to the primary CTA. CRITERIA: 1. Must be located directly above or below the Add to Cart/Buy Now button. 2. Must include a countdown or specific cutoff time (e.g., 'Order within 2 hours', 'Order by 3 PM'). 3. Must provide a specific delivery date or range (e.g., 'Get it by Tuesday, Oct 12th', 'Delivered by Thursday'). IMPACT: High - This reduces purchase friction and prevents cart abandonment by managing expectations upfront.

expectedResult.reason: Shipping information is missing near the 'Add to Cart' button. The page does not display a dynamic delivery estimate with a countdown or specific cutoff time, nor does it provide a specific delivery date. This fails to meet the rule's requirements for managing customer expectations upfront.
